page.title: 05Mr Breed's Nature Trail
page.content: {Mr John Breeds}is the warden of{ {Braunton Burrows}Nature Area. His job is to look after the wildlife and keep an eye on the Burrows to make sure it is being well protected. He came to our school in a landrover to help transport us to the car park to start the nature trail. Throughout the walk he told us of the hundreds of things there is to see on the Burrows. The first thing that struck us was the large amount of blue, tall plants called{Vipers {Bugloss.}We followed a path through the scrub noticing caterpillars (lackey Moths), wild orchids, moss and brambles. One of the children{(Susie {Nightingale),}nearly jumped out of her skin when she almost stepped on a large green frog.
